update.description:
To test #2297:

1. Start gazebo in record mode and paused: `gazebo -r -u`
2. Insert double pendulum.
3. Play
4. Pause and quite gazebo
5. Replay the log file.
    a. Without this fix, the double pendulum is not inserted.

To test #2428:

1. Open Gazebo
2. Insert some models, at least one of them should move, like the double pendulum
3. Record a log
4. Close Gazebo
5. Start Gazebo playing back the log.

Side affect fix: Ghosting models in log playback was caused by not clearing the `insertions` (and related `deletions`) vectors in `WorldState`.
update.title: Fix for issues #2297 and #2428

content.html:
here's a quick patch to a world to reproduce this behavior:

  • https://gist.github.com/scpeters/614025b22517eff138711a3af7f12b90

content.raw: There is a side effect to this change: currently if there are multiple models with the same name in a world, currently they will all load, but you can't query them by name, and if you try to delete one, it will delete the others too. With this change, it will give a warning message and fail to load the models with name collisions. Maybe we want to do this, but it is a behavior change, so we should think carefully about including that in a minor release.
content.html: There is a side effect to this change: currently if there are multiple models with the same name in a world, currently they will all load, but you can't query them by name, and if you try to delete one, it will delete the others too. With this change, it will give a warning message and fail to load the models with name collisions. Maybe we want to do this, but it is a behavior change, so we should think carefully about including that in a minor release.

content.raw: Yup, see [this SDFormat issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/151/trying-to-parse-an-invalid-file-gives-urdf)
content.html: Yup, see this SDFormat issue

content.raw:
I think that error message comes from [WorldState::SetInsertions](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1540d7970559f2f49571528bb28d171fb062e972/gazebo/physics/WorldState.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#WorldState.cc-398:402). The sdf string is initially wrapped in `<sdf>` tags when it is inserted via the call to [InsertModelString](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1540d7970559f2f49571528bb28d171fb062e972/test/regression/2428_log_insertions.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#2428_log_insertions.cc-57:73), but that gets stripped out in the [WorldState subtraction](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1540d7970559f2f49571528bb28d171fb062e972/gazebo/physics/WorldState.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#WorldState.cc-534), so it just starts with `<model>` tags. Then when [WorldState::SetInsertions calls sdf::readString](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1540d7970559f2f49571528bb28d171fb062e972/gazebo/physics/WorldState.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#WorldState.cc-372), that function gives an error because the input is not wrapped in `<sdf>` tags.

It still works, but there is an extraneous console message.
content.html:
I think that error message comes from WorldState::SetInsertions. The sdf string is initially wrapped in <sdf> tags when it is inserted via the call to InsertModelString, but that gets stripped out in the WorldState subtraction, so it just starts with <model> tags. Then when WorldState::SetInsertions calls sdf::readString, that function gives an error because the input is not wrapped in <sdf> tags.

It still works, but there is an extraneous console message.

content.raw:
Heads up that it's not just the ur10 insertion that generates the

```

Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:342] parse as old deprecated model file failed.

```
errors. Calls to `rosrun gazebo_ros spawn_model` seem to cause it to be output (but only if logging is enabled). I'll document in our ARIAC tutorials that this is expected, but it might impact other use cases (though I don't think state logging usage is too common).

Example:
```
rosrun gazebo_ros spawn_model -sdf -model pulley_part_2 -x 0.96 -y 2.58 -z 0.9 -file `catkin_find osrf_gear --first-only --share`/models/pulley_part_ariac/model.sdf
```
content.html:

errors. Calls to rosrun gazebo_ros spawn_model seem to cause it to be output (but only if logging is enabled). I'll document in our ARIAC tutorials that this is expected, but it might impact other use cases (though I don't think state logging usage is too common).

Example:

rosrun gazebo_ros spawn_model -sdf -model pulley_part_2 -x 0.96 -y 2.58 -z 0.9 -file `catkin_find osrf_gear --first-only --share`/models/pulley_part_ariac/model.sdf

We're pretty keen for a gazebo release for ARIAC, so I'd like for this PR to not be blocked if this issue if it's as minor as it seems and can be done as a followup improvement. But, if it signals that something deeper is off, I understand if we can't merge this yet.

content.raw: I updated some expectations slightly in 9bb14a9 and adjusted the startup of the test for 2428, so that it is not also testing #2297
content.html: I updated some expectations slightly in 9bb14a9 and adjusted the startup of the test for 2428, so that it is not also testing #2297

update.description:
To test #2297:

1. Start gazebo in record mode and paused: `gazebo -r -u`
2. Insert double pendulum.
3. Play
4. Pause and quite gazebo
5. Replay the log file.
    a. Without this fix, the double pendulum is not inserted.

To test #2428:

1. Open Gazebo
2. Insert some models, at least one of them should move, like the double pendulum
3. Record a log
4. Close Gazebo
5. Start Gazebo playing back the log.

Side affect fix: Ghosting models in log playback was caused by not clearing the `insertions` (and related `deletions`) vectors in `WorldState`.
update.title: Fix for issues #2297 and #2428

content.raw: I'm killing two birds with on stone. Issue #2297 is about a missing `<insertion>`. While solving this issue I noticed that gazebo8 can include the `<insertion>` tag multiple times. So, I figured it doesn't hurt to make sure we don't do that either.
content.html: I'm killing two birds with on stone. Issue #2297 is about a missing <insertion>. While solving this issue I noticed that gazebo8 can include the <insertion> tag multiple times. So, I figured it doesn't hurt to make sure we don't do that either.

content.raw: I mean this is also wrong if there are multiple insertions, but it just surprised me that it doesn't match the problem in issue #2297
content.html: I mean this is also wrong if there are multiple insertions, but it just surprised me that it doesn't match the problem in issue #2297

content.raw: I'm a little confused by the logic here. I thought the problem was that the insertions tag was missing?
content.html: I'm a little confused by the logic here. I thought the problem was that the insertions tag was missing?
